articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS is remaining positive, despite anxiety among the Celtic support about the lack of summer signings. The Hoops manager insists he will not get drawn into the “toxic and negative energy that comes with transfers”. The champions have added just one outfield player to last season’s double-winning pool and that is Paulo Bernardo who [...]

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: My friends in Celtic, on Sunday we will gather to watch the league flag fly high above Celtic Park, the Scottish Cup is on display in the boardroom and in six weeks we will be among the first fans to watch the new Champions League format get underway. Financially, things have literally never been better.  [...]

articles.description: WILL Celtic be afforded the respect as Premiership champions when they take the field at Parkhead on Sunday for the big league kick-off? Last season, James Forrest, in his testimonial year, was first [...]

articles.description: TOMMY BURNS was riding a rollercoaster of emotions during the turbulent 1996/97 crusade. That was followed by a barren term and all eyes were on the boss during a third challenging season. In [...]

articles.description: MIKAEL LUSTIG spent his glory years at Celtic and won SIXTEEN honours – eight successive league titles, four Scottish Cups and four League Cups. The Swedish defender, who also featured in three back-to-back trebles, became a fans’ favourite with his wholehearted displays plus his zany antics, one of which figured the donning of a policeman’s hat [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO MIKAEL LUSTIG?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PAULO BERNARDO wasted no time in underlining one of his essential reasons for returning to Celtic on a five-year contract. The classy Portuguese midfielder this evening sealed his £3.4million move from Benfica after last season’s impressive loan at the Hoops and admitted he’s back for more silverware. Bernardo is eager to get among the honours again [...]

articles.description: Football is theatre and good theatrical producers know how to put on a show.  That being the case, Celtic will take the opportunity to give the club a timely boost on the cusp of the opening game of the season by announcing the signing of Paulo Bernardo.  Perhaps our former campaigning Irish striker will even [...]

articles.description:
The Ghirls kick off the 2024/25 campaign when Elena Sadiku’s title-winning side take on Dundee United at Celtic Park on Saturday, August 10. In yet another milestone for the history-making team, Celtic FC Women will unfurl the Champions’ flag for the first time in the SWPL, before kick-off at 1pm. Be there to show your […]

articles.title: GHIRLS IN GREEN

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Hibs cutting Celtic’s allocation for the first away game of the season is more unwelcome news for Celtic fans. The allocation has been cut by just under 700 tickets which make it even harder now to nail down a ticket and push more Celtic fans into trying to get tickets to sit with Hibs fans. […]
The post Away Days Ticket Cut appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: Away Days Ticket Cut

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
The details for Celtic v Hibs in the League Cup last 16 tie  have been confirmed. Celtic  will take on Hibs at Celtic Park on Sunday, August 18. Kick-off will be at 3pm with the match televised on Premier Sports 1.

articles.title: Celtic v Hibs League Cup Clash
